lessons_learned: Intel was stale - CNSC hearing already happened Dec 11 2025
Fenrir repeated old info without verification
Panic sold on red when thesis wasnt broken
Same day stock ran +6.49% after exit
rule_violations: Sold on emotion not thesis break
No stop loss set before entry

lessons_learned: High convergence + volume confirmation = stronger setup
Wounded prey pattern showing real edge
Defense sector running on policy tailwinds
Small speculative positions can run big
Extended hours data not visible on Fidelity heatmap

extended_hours_blindspot.problem: Fidelity heatmaps do NOT update with extended hours trading
extended_hours_blindspot.example: MRNO showed +56.30% on heatmap but was actually +111.75% after-hours
extended_hours_blindspot.solution: Build Wolf Pack Heatmap tool with Finnhub WebSocket for real-time extended hours data

stale_intel_danger.problem: AI repeated old catalyst info without verification
stale_intel_danger.example: DNN CNSC hearing already happened Dec 11 2025, not upcoming
stale_intel_danger.solution: All intel must be timestamped and verified fresh before acting
stale_intel_danger.rule: No 'any day' language - real timelines or 'unknown'

cash_debit_explanation.what_it_means: T+1 settlement creates temporary debit until trade settles
cash_debit_explanation.example: -$50.59 debit = committed funds from RDW purchase, not actual negative balance

honesty_framework.question_asked: If we are trading and the system learns from our trades, is it a lie to say the system made decisions?
honesty_framework.answer: NO - human decisions become training data, AI learns patterns from outcomes
honest_statements: I made this trade. I'm documenting it. The system is learning from my decisions.
I'm building a system that learns from real trades.
The system improves as I feed it more data.
dishonest_statements: The AI system predicted this winner (when human decided)
honesty_framework.truth: Right now the HUMAN is the system. Human judgment becomes training data.

transparency_commitment: Document EVERY trade: entry, exit, thesis, outcome
Show the learning process, not just results
Let the work speak for itself

pack_rules: We win together, lose together. Every dollar is OUR dollar.
No lazy research. All intel timestamped and verified fresh.
No panic sells. Thesis didn't break = hold through noise.
Document everything. Wins, losses, reasoning - all public.
Build for everyone. Tools for people who can't afford institutional shit.
trading_rules_reinforced: 10% mandatory stop loss on all positions
Small speculative positions only (<2% of portfolio)

working: IBRX wounded prey pattern (55%+ gain, still holding)
Defense sector timing on policy catalysts
not_working: Buying on stale intel without verification
Panic selling on red days when thesis intact

key_insight: The edge isn't in finding universal patterns but in understanding which specific stocks have 'continuation DNA' versus those that mean-revert. Document everything, learn from outcomes, adjust the model.
